title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 456.3 - Mandated statistical bases for cost allocation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 456.3 - Mandated statistical bases for cost allocation

State Regulations

The following represent the minimum mandated statistical
bases for cost allocation. (a) Nonrevenue support services. Functional reporting                   Allocation basis
center
(1)  Depreciation, Leases     Depreciation by building, by department
and Rentals
(2)  Depreciation on Major    For assets acquired prior to 1/1/78, Movable Equipment        depreciation may be allocated to departments
based on square feet, net. For major movable equipment acquisitions
subsequent to 1/1/78, depreciation on such
assets must be assigned based on the physical
location of the equipment. (3)  Interest on Capital      Square feet of building for which debt incurred

Debt                     and actual depreciation of major movable
equipment
(4)  Fiscal Services          Accumulated costs
(5)  Administrative Services  Accumulated costs
(6)  Plant Operation and      Square feet, net

Maintenance
(7)  Grounds                  Square feet, net
(8)  Security                 Square feet, net
(9)  Laundry and Linen        Dry and clean pounds distributed, includes the
equivalent weight of disposable linens
distributed
(10)  Housekeeping             Assigned time
(11)  Patient Food Service     Dietary meals served
(12)  Cafeteria                Average number of employees
(13)  Nursing Administration   Total hours of direct nursing service
(14)  Activities Program       Number of participants, by program
(15)  Non-Physician Education  Assigned time of students
(16)  Medical Education        Assigned time--interns and residents
(17)  Medical Director's       Time spent

Office*
(18)  Housing                  Number of rooms occupied by department assigned
(19)  Medical Records*         Hours of service
(20)  Utilization Review       Number of cases reviewed, by program area
(21)  Social Services*         Hours of service
(22)  Transportation*          Number of users, by program
(b) Ancillary
service revenue centers. Functional reporting center         Allocation basis
(1)  Laboratory Services           CAP workload measurement units
(2)  Electrocardiology             CAP workload measurement units
(3)  Electroencephalogy            CAP workload measurement units
(4)  Radiology                     Relative value units
(5)  Inhalation Therapy            Number of treatments
(6)  Podiatry                      Number of visits
(7)  Dental                        Number of visits
(8)  Psychiatric                   Number of visits
(9)  Physical Therapy              Number of treatments
(10)  Occupational Therapy          Number of treatments
(11)  Speech and Hearing Therapy    Number of treatments
(12)  Medical Staff Services*       Hours of service by physician
(13)  Pharmacy**                    Costed requisitions
(14)  Central Service Supply**      Costed requisitions
(c) Exceptions. *
(1)

For facilities with a single program
service classification the cost allocation bases indicated in subdivisions (a)
and (b) of this section by an asterisk (*) are waived. **
(2)

In Pharmacy and Central Services Supply cost
centers, indicated by (**) in subdivision (b) of this section, for facilities
with a single program service classification the cost allocation bases are
waived. However, requisitions for these cost centers for the sample periods
must be retained as an audit trail showing that such supplies were not utilized
in areas other than the program area. Also, for Pharmacy costs in multicare
facilities, see section
456.5
(p) of this

Part for alternate pricing out of requisitions allowable. Notes
